Posts.EditableText:
Hi again it seems there is an issue with Quest where neither me or any of players of my games can't seem to play.
The message we're getting back is Runtime Error '/ ' Application, here is the full report:
Runtime Error
Description: An application error occurred on the server. The current custom error settings for this application prevent the details of the application error from being viewed remotely (for security reasons). It could, however, be viewed by browsers running on the local server machine.

Details: To enable the details of this specific error message to be viewable on remote machines, please create a <customErrors> tag within a "web.config" configuration file located in the root directory of the current web application. This <customErrors> tag should then have its "mode" attribute set to "Off".

<!-- Web.Config Configuration File -->

<configuration>
    <system.web>
        <customErrors mode="Off"/>
    </system.web>
</configuration>

Notes: The current error page you are seeing can be replaced by a custom error page by modifying the "defaultRedirect" attribute of the application's <customErrors> configuration tag to point to a custom error page URL.

<!-- Web.Config Configuration File -->

<configuration>
    <system.web>
        <customErrors mode="RemoteOnly" defaultRedirect="mycustompage.htm"/>
    </system.web>
</configuration>
Now this is only associated with gameplay, I can still create games and edit them. However gameplay, whether its my games or others, keeps returning this error. Hopefully it just a minor glitch for now and nothing serious.

Posts.EditableText: ONLINE QUEST : Editor and game both now not working! Game loads and mostly ends instantly or after seconds. Editor loads, but making 1 delete to a script ends with "an internal error"! Seems Quest needs some serious Admin help!

Posts.EditableText:
Hello. I am new here and for the past 2 days have been having a similar issue. Game constantly times out, giving the potential player no time to save. Endless loading screens and no mobile support have been consistent issues aswell.

Has anyone seen something like this before in the community? It seems like an issue on the sites page, and I'm curious as to how soon we can expect a solution. I am a big fan of text based rpgs, and hope to continue to work on this well made system for people such as myself. Thank you for your time.

Posts.EditableText:
The only thing that comes close to an issue like this is when Quest was basically not useable a while back. For some odd reason any attempt to make, edit, delete, and even play were rendered useless (game creation and deletion required a bit of browser hopping to make happen). It took a message to the admins to do something with the server to have everything go back to normal, though that situation has permanently changed aspects of my normal browser, things I have no idea on how to fix. All we can do is hope that an Admin sees or gets wind of this issue and manages to fix it.

Edit: I'm also getting the internal error as well after any deletion.
